trans-unit.source: Script Action can be used to install additional software running on a Hadoop cluster or to change the configuration of applications installed on a cluster.
trans-unit.target: Script Action can be used to install additional software running on a Hadoop cluster or to change the configuration of applications installed on a cluster.

trans-unit.source: Script actions are scripts that run on the cluster nodes when HDInsight clusters are deployed, and they are executed once nodes in the cluster complete HDInsight configuration.
trans-unit.target: Script actions are scripts that run on the cluster nodes when HDInsight clusters are deployed, and they are executed once nodes in the cluster complete HDInsight configuration.

trans-unit.source: A script action is executed under system admin account privileges and provides full access rights to the cluster nodes.
trans-unit.target: A script action is executed under system admin account privileges and provides full access rights to the cluster nodes.

trans-unit.source: Each cluster can be provided with a list of script actions to be executed in the order in which they are specified.
trans-unit.target: Each cluster can be provided with a list of script actions to be executed in the order in which they are specified.

trans-unit.source: Best practices for script development
trans-unit.target: Best practices for script development

trans-unit.source: When you develop a custom script for an HDInsight cluster, there are several best practices to keep in mind:
trans-unit.target: When you develop a custom script for an HDInsight cluster, there are several best practices to keep in mind:

trans-unit.source: Check for the Hadoop version
trans-unit.target: Check for the Hadoop version

trans-unit.source: Only HDInsight version 3.1 (Hadoop 2.4) and above support using Script Action to install custom components on a cluster.
trans-unit.target: Only HDInsight version 3.1 (Hadoop 2.4) and above support using Script Action to install custom components on a cluster.

trans-unit.source: In your custom script, you must use the **Get-HDIHadoopVersion** helper method to check the Hadoop version before proceeding with performing other tasks in the script.
trans-unit.target: In your custom script, you must use the **Get-HDIHadoopVersion** helper method to check the Hadoop version before proceeding with performing other tasks in the script.

trans-unit.source: Provide stable links to script resources
trans-unit.target: Provide stable links to script resources

trans-unit.source: Users should make sure that all of the scripts and other artifacts used in the customization of a cluster remain available throughout the lifetime of the cluster and that the versions of these files do not change for the duration.
trans-unit.target: Users should make sure that all of the scripts and other artifacts used in the customization of a cluster remain available throughout the lifetime of the cluster and that the versions of these files do not change for the duration.

trans-unit.source: These resources are required if the re-imaging of nodes in the cluster is required.
trans-unit.target: These resources are required if the re-imaging of nodes in the cluster is required.

trans-unit.source: The best practice is to download and archive everything in a Storage account that the user controls.
trans-unit.target: The best practice is to download and archive everything in a Storage account that the user controls.

trans-unit.source: This can be the default Storage account or any of the additional Storage accounts specified at the time of deployment for a customized cluster.
trans-unit.target: This can be the default Storage account or any of the additional Storage accounts specified at the time of deployment for a customized cluster.

trans-unit.source: In the Spark and R customized cluster samples provided in the documentation, for example, we have made a local copy of the resources in this Storage account: https://hdiconfigactions.blob.core.windows.net/.
trans-unit.target: In the Spark and R customized cluster samples provided in the documentation, for example, we have made a local copy of the resources in this Storage account: https://hdiconfigactions.blob.core.windows.net/.

trans-unit.source: Ensure that the cluster customization script is idempotent
trans-unit.target: Ensure that the cluster customization script is idempotent

trans-unit.source: You must expect that the nodes of an HDInsight cluster will be re-imaged during the cluster lifetime.
trans-unit.target: You must expect that the nodes of an HDInsight cluster will be re-imaged during the cluster lifetime.

trans-unit.source: The cluster customization script is run whenever a cluster is re-imaged.
trans-unit.target: The cluster customization script is run whenever a cluster is re-imaged.

trans-unit.source: This script must be designed to be idempotent in the sense that upon re-imaging, the script should ensure that the cluster is returned to the same customized state that it was in just after the script ran for the first time when the cluster was initially created.
trans-unit.target: This script must be designed to be idempotent in the sense that upon re-imaging, the script should ensure that the cluster is returned to the same customized state that it was in just after the script ran for the first time when the cluster was initially created.

trans-unit.source: For example, if a custom script installed an application at D:\AppLocation on its first run, then on each subsequent run, upon re-imaging, the script should check whether the application exists at the D:\AppLocation location before proceeding with other steps in the script.
trans-unit.target: For example, if a custom script installed an application at D:\AppLocation on its first run, then on each subsequent run, upon re-imaging, the script should check whether the application exists at the D:\AppLocation location before proceeding with other steps in the script.

trans-unit.source: Install custom components in the optimal location
trans-unit.target: Install custom components in the optimal location

trans-unit.source: When cluster nodes are re-imaged, the C:\ resource drive and D:\ system drive can be re-formatted, resulting in the loss of data and applications that had been installed on those drives.
trans-unit.target: When cluster nodes are re-imaged, the C:\ resource drive and D:\ system drive can be re-formatted, resulting in the loss of data and applications that had been installed on those drives.

trans-unit.source: This could also happen if an Azure virtual machine (VM) node that is part of the cluster goes down and is replaced by a new node.
trans-unit.target: This could also happen if an Azure virtual machine (VM) node that is part of the cluster goes down and is replaced by a new node.

trans-unit.source: You can install components on the D:\ drive or in the C:\apps location on the cluster.
trans-unit.target: You can install components on the D:\ drive or in the C:\apps location on the cluster.

trans-unit.source: All other locations on the C:\ drive are reserved.
trans-unit.target: All other locations on the C:\ drive are reserved.

trans-unit.source: Specify the location where applications or libraries are to be installed in the cluster customization script.
trans-unit.target: Specify the location where applications or libraries are to be installed in the cluster customization script.

trans-unit.source: Ensure high availability of the cluster architecture
trans-unit.target: Ensure high availability of the cluster architecture

trans-unit.source: HDInsight has an active-passive architecture for high availability, in which one head node is in active mode (where the HDInsight services are running) and the other head node is in standby mode (in which HDInsight services are not running).
trans-unit.target: HDInsight has an active-passive architecture for high availability, in which one head node is in active mode (where the HDInsight services are running) and the other head node is in standby mode (in which HDInsight services are not running).

trans-unit.source: The nodes switch active and passive modes if HDInsight services are interrupted.
trans-unit.target: The nodes switch active and passive modes if HDInsight services are interrupted.

trans-unit.source: If a script action is used to install services on both head nodes for high availability, note that the HDInsight failover mechanism will not be able to automatically fail over these user-installed services.
trans-unit.target: If a script action is used to install services on both head nodes for high availability, note that the HDInsight failover mechanism will not be able to automatically fail over these user-installed services.

trans-unit.source: So user-installed services on HDInsight head nodes that are expected to be highly available must either have their own failover mechanism if in active-passive mode or be in active-active mode.
trans-unit.target: So user-installed services on HDInsight head nodes that are expected to be highly available must either have their own failover mechanism if in active-passive mode or be in active-active mode.

trans-unit.source: An HDInsight Script Action command runs on both head nodes when the head-node role is specified as a value in the *ClusterRoleCollection* parameter (documented below in the section [How to run a script action](#runScriptAction)).
trans-unit.target: An HDInsight Script Action command runs on both head nodes when the head-node role is specified as a value in the *ClusterRoleCollection* parameter (documented below in the section [How to run a script action](#runScriptAction)).

trans-unit.source: So when you design a custom script, make sure that your script is aware of this setup.
trans-unit.target: So when you design a custom script, make sure that your script is aware of this setup.

trans-unit.source: You should not run into problems where the same services are installed and started on both of the head nodes and they end up competing with each other.
trans-unit.target: You should not run into problems where the same services are installed and started on both of the head nodes and they end up competing with each other.

trans-unit.source: Also, be aware that data will be lost during re-imaging, so software installed via Script Action has to be resilient to such events.
trans-unit.target: Also, be aware that data will be lost during re-imaging, so software installed via Script Action has to be resilient to such events.

trans-unit.source: Applications should be designed to work with highly available data that is distributed across many nodes.
trans-unit.target: Applications should be designed to work with highly available data that is distributed across many nodes.

trans-unit.source: Note that as many as 1/5 of the nodes in a cluster can be re-imaged at the same time.
trans-unit.target: Note that as many as 1/5 of the nodes in a cluster can be re-imaged at the same time.

trans-unit.source: Configure the custom components to use Azure Blob storage
trans-unit.target: Configure the custom components to use Azure Blob storage

trans-unit.source: The custom components that you install on the cluster nodes might have a default configuration to use Hadoop Distributed File System (HDFS) storage.
trans-unit.target: The custom components that you install on the cluster nodes might have a default configuration to use Hadoop Distributed File System (HDFS) storage.

trans-unit.source: You should change the configuration to use Azure Blob storage instead.
trans-unit.target: You should change the configuration to use Azure Blob storage instead.

trans-unit.source: On a cluster re-image, the HDFS file system gets formatted and you would lose any data that is stored there.
trans-unit.target: On a cluster re-image, the HDFS file system gets formatted and you would lose any data that is stored there.

trans-unit.source: Using Azure Blob storage instead ensures that your data will be retained.
trans-unit.target: Using Azure Blob storage instead ensures that your data will be retained.

trans-unit.target: Here are the steps we took when preparing to deploy these scripts:

trans-unit.source: Put the files that contain the custom scripts in a place that is accessible by the cluster nodes during deployment.
trans-unit.target: Put the files that contain the custom scripts in a place that is accessible by the cluster nodes during deployment.

trans-unit.source: This can be any of the default or additional Storage accounts specified at the time of cluster deployment, or any other publicly accessible storage container.
trans-unit.target: This can be any of the default or additional Storage accounts specified at the time of cluster deployment, or any other publicly accessible storage container.

trans-unit.source: Add checks into scripts to make sure that they execute idempotently, so that the script can be executed multiple times on the same node.
trans-unit.target: Add checks into scripts to make sure that they execute idempotently, so that the script can be executed multiple times on the same node.

trans-unit.source: Use the **Write-Output** Azure PowerShell cmdlet to print to STDOUT as well as STDERR.
trans-unit.target: Use the **Write-Output** Azure PowerShell cmdlet to print to STDOUT as well as STDERR.

trans-unit.source: Do not use **Write-Host**.
trans-unit.target: Do not use **Write-Host**.

trans-unit.source: Use a temporary file folder, such as $env:TEMP, to keep the downloaded file used by the scripts and then clean them up after scripts have executed.
trans-unit.target: Use a temporary file folder, such as $env:TEMP, to keep the downloaded file used by the scripts and then clean them up after scripts have executed.

trans-unit.source: Install custom software only at D:\ or C:\apps.
trans-unit.target: Install custom software only at D:\ or C:\apps.

trans-unit.source: Other locations on the C: drive should not be used as they are reserved.
trans-unit.target: Other locations on the C: drive should not be used as they are reserved.

trans-unit.source: Note that installing files on the C: drive outside of the C:\apps folder may result in setup failures during re-images of the node.
trans-unit.target: Note that installing files on the C: drive outside of the C:\apps folder may result in setup failures during re-images of the node.

trans-unit.source: In the event that OS-level settings or Hadoop service configuration files were changed, you may want to restart HDInsight services so that they can pick up any OS-level settings, such as the environment variables set in the scripts.
trans-unit.target: In the event that OS-level settings or Hadoop service configuration files were changed, you may want to restart HDInsight services so that they can pick up any OS-level settings, such as the environment variables set in the scripts.

trans-unit.source: Test custom scripts with the HDInsight Emulator
trans-unit.target: Test custom scripts with the HDInsight Emulator

trans-unit.source: A straight-forward way to test a custom script before using it in the HDInsight Script Action command is to run it on the HDInsight Emulator.
trans-unit.target: A straight-forward way to test a custom script before using it in the HDInsight Script Action command is to run it on the HDInsight Emulator.

trans-unit.source: You can install the HDInsight Emulator locally or on an Azure infrastructure as a service (IaaS) Windows Server 2012 R2 VM or on a local machine and observe if the script behaves correctly.
trans-unit.target: You can install the HDInsight Emulator locally or on an Azure infrastructure as a service (IaaS) Windows Server 2012 R2 VM or on a local machine and observe if the script behaves correctly.

trans-unit.source: Note that the Windows Server 2012 R2 VM is the same VM that HDInsight uses for its nodes.
trans-unit.target: Note that the Windows Server 2012 R2 VM is the same VM that HDInsight uses for its nodes.

trans-unit.source: This section outlines the procedure for using the HDInsight Emulator locally for testing purposes, but the procedure for using a VM is similar.

trans-unit.target: For instructions on how to install it, see [Get started with the HDInsight Emulator](../hdinsight-get-started-emulator/).

trans-unit.source: Debug custom scripts
trans-unit.target: Debug custom scripts

trans-unit.source: The script error logs are stored, along with other output, in the default Storage account that you specified for the cluster at its creation.
trans-unit.target: The script error logs are stored, along with other output, in the default Storage account that you specified for the cluster at its creation.

trans-unit.source: The logs are stored in a table with the name *u<\cluster-name-fragment><\time-stamp>setuplog*.
trans-unit.target: The logs are stored in a table with the name *u<\cluster-name-fragment><\time-stamp>setuplog*.

trans-unit.source: These are aggregated logs that have records from all of the nodes (head node and worker nodes) on which the script runs in the cluster.
trans-unit.target: These are aggregated logs that have records from all of the nodes (head node and worker nodes) on which the script runs in the cluster.

trans-unit.source: An easy way to check the logs is to use HDInsight Tools for Visual Studio.
trans-unit.target: An easy way to check the logs is to use HDInsight Tools for Visual Studio.

trans-unit.source: For installing the tools, see [Get started using Visual Studio Hadoop tools for HDInsight](hdinsight-hadoop-visual-studio-tools-get-started.md#install-hdinsight-tools-for-visual-studio)
trans-unit.target: For installing the tools, see [Get started using Visual Studio Hadoop tools for HDInsight](hdinsight-hadoop-visual-studio-tools-get-started.md#install-hdinsight-tools-for-visual-studio)

trans-unit.source: **To check the log using Visual Studio**
trans-unit.target: **To check the log using Visual Studio**

trans-unit.source: Open Visual Studio.
trans-unit.target: Open Visual Studio.

trans-unit.source: Click **View**, and then click **Server Explorer**.
trans-unit.target: Click **View**, and then click **Server Explorer**.

trans-unit.source: Right-click "Azure", click Connect to **Microsoft Azure Subscriptions**, and then enter your credentials.
trans-unit.target: Right-click "Azure", click Connect to **Microsoft Azure Subscriptions**, and then enter your credentials.

trans-unit.source: Expand **Storage**, expand the Azure storage account used as the default file system, expand **Tables**, and then double-click the table name.
trans-unit.target: Expand **Storage**, expand the Azure storage account used as the default file system, expand **Tables**, and then double-click the table name.

trans-unit.source: You can also remote into the cluster nodes to see the both STDOUT and STDERR for custom scripts.
trans-unit.target: You can also remote into the cluster nodes to see the both STDOUT and STDERR for custom scripts.

trans-unit.source: The logs on each node are specific only to that node and are logged into **C:\HDInsightLogs\DeploymentAgent.log**.
trans-unit.target: The logs on each node are specific only to that node and are logged into **C:\HDInsightLogs\DeploymentAgent.log**.

trans-unit.source: These log files record all outputs from the custom script.
trans-unit.target: These log files record all outputs from the custom script.
